definitions: To recover from an illness, a difficult experience, or an emotional setback.
To overcome a problem or an obstacle.
To accept an unpleasant fact or situation.
To communicate or explain something successfully.
To travel across or move from one side to another.
examples: It took her a long time to get over the flu.
He's finding it hard to get over his ex-girlfriend.
We need to get over this hurdle to finish the project.
I hope I can get my point over to the audience.
How do we get over to the other side of the river?
